ygData.subject: Re: OOC r/l musical bards?
ygData.msgSnippet: Occasionally I ll dabble in the dark arts of techno/trance music.  My research in this field is quite extensive, the collection is over 400 cds now.  I dont
ygData.messageBody:
Occasionally I'll dabble in the dark arts of techno/trance music. My
research in this field is quite extensive, the collection is over 400 cds
now. I dont reccomend it, it's an expensive trade, far too much plat is
invested.

Gediprime
Xegony


----- Original Message -----
From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 3:21 PM
Subject: [eqbards] OOC r/l musical bards?


> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> So we are all real good online Bards and have excellent musical abilities
to
> the point of powerful magic, etc. But what about in /ooc real life?
Anyone
> have any talent or interest?
>
> Sylly
> Bard of the 11th level
> HogCallers Inn
> Freeport, Innoruuk
>
> p.s. in 5th grade public school, the music teacher got so frustrated with
my
> inability to start a song on his 'downbeat' or whatever you call it, he
> snatched the tone block off my desk and never let me try again. I
generally
> hate to sing in public - I am tone deaf and totally lack any rythmn.
>
> "you miss beat, your song abruptly ends" has been the story of my r/l
> musical ventures - I do have a nice stereo <g>
>
